title: Tokyo - Day with old friends
content:
Today we had arranged to meet an old friend of mine and his family. 

Our meeting place was the Tokyo Metropolitan Government building observation deck, which meant we got to ride some local Tokyo trains! This was nothing new for me, but the rest of the group got the full Tokyo rush-hour experience - heaps of passengers crammed into the train, busy stations, and all the sounds! I enjoyed seeing and hearing the reactions.

The observation deck was pretty busy - it seems it has become much more popular these days. The day was perfect though, and the views were spectacular - Mt Fuji was hanging out in clear view in the distance. We met my friends and walked to a place for lunch down a side-street - a pretty standard set meal offering, so it was delicious.

Last on our list for the day was Nippori "Fabric Town" - a place Mum was very keen to grab some Japan-made fabric from as a souvenir! This was a nice different experience, seeing smaller and long-standing shops run by locals.
